BGRI
  • News
  • People
  • Research
  • Outputs

BBSRC-HGCA Black-grass Resistance Initiative

Understanding herbicide resistance from the molecular to the farm scale

People

Find out about the research team overseeing the BGRI. Information about employment opportunities for undergraduates, grraduate research positions and posts docs will also be posted here as they become available.

Outputs

As the project develops a summary of project outputs (e.g. scientific papers, outreach activities and resources) will be posted in this repository.

Research

The BBSRC-HGCA funded BGRI comprises five interlinked work packages that aim to address a broad suite of questions of fundamental and applied importance.


BGRI

Black-grass Resistance Initiative

Work Package 1

Molecular mechanisms underpinning the evolution of MHR in black-grass

Work Package 2

Black-grass population monitoring and resistance audit

Work Package 3

Genetic architecture and inheritance of MHR

Work Package 4

Eco-evolutionary modelling of black-grass populations

Work Package 5

Asessing wider impacts of resistance and management
